ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.

What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned so much about grammar, Brazilian culture and activism, food, dance, music, and so much more. The course did a phenomenal job integrating current global discussion topics and allowing us to practice our knowledge about Portuguese to share our thoughts and reflections. The readings were very engaging and the assigned videos were always something to look forward to. I thoroughly enjoyed learning throughout this class and am very grateful I had the chance to take it. One of the best classes I have taken so far.
Portuguese but with an emphasis on writing and creating media in Portuguese.
A solid knowledge of both linguistics and cultural elements of Brazil

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: supportive learning environment, interesting and relevant content, a lot of meaningful discussions and class engagement 
Weakness: sometimes I felt like too many assignments were assigned at once.
Went a bit fast, but the teacher is incredibly nice and helpful.
The course had very fun activities

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Successful: the combination of synchronous and asynchronous classes, digital readings and museums, and virtual exploration of Brazilian music and dance
Weakness: none
Breakout rooms were very helpful to increase personal interactions in Portuguese

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! Portuguese is such a fantastic course. Professora Giseli is very supportive and engaged, and truly cares about the learning process for all students.
If you want to learn Portuguese then yeah. Professor Tordin is very nice and her lectures are pretty fun. She also knows alot about Brazilian culture (which this class focuses on).
Yes, the course was really fun
